channel.title: What is PHP and is it required on websites
channel.description: well php what does it do to your website? cause people always talk about it and im confused... No flamming pl0x. :| :| :| :rolleyes: and dosen't this questions gos here?

item.title: What is PHP and is it required on websites
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

jsp // servlets fall under Java EE tbh. Thou jsp is an outadated bit of kit imo, it mixes the buisness logic with the presentation layer. Not something I am fond of, but I am also a component based dev freak. Everything on a page is an instance of a class which generates its own code (for rendering), the components should be flexible and should not interact with any of the buisness logic directly. Rather the buisness logic should pass information to components to allow them to do their job. Flexibility, ood, reuse of components.

Look at things such as echo2 web framework (not that im endorsing this framework, it certainly has its issues) for more information. There are however alot of component based java frameworks out there, and some for .net (well webforms IS a component based framework, how the developers USE webforms is another matter). Tapestry is good too.

Read full topic
item.source: What is PHP and is it required on websites

item.title: What is PHP and is it required on websites
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

[offtopic]yeah I remember you, alloz!

im not back, just passing through. Mopman linked to a thread so I felt like flaming as im not in the mood to do any work.[/offtopic]

Sure, php can be used to bodge stupid things together. I dont have a problem with people doing that, but its become the ‘community’ standard, and thats where I start having grievances against it. They treat it as ‘the one true web language’. Alot of software is developed in php, webhosts think all anyone will need is php + mysql. It is not the holy grail of the web development world, far from it. When real companies want real websites they go to real developers for one of two things, Java EE or .net webapps. Or atleast those are the two major technologies prevalant in this region. PHP wont get a lookin for any real work.

Read full topic

item.source: What is PHP and is it required on websites

item.title: What is PHP and is it required on websites
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

Php is extremely limited, its library is a mess (the function names disgust me). Its oo is nothing but a joke, really. Simple language features can only be used in certain places without it breaking, applying any oo pardiyms (ive tried to implement several simple design patterns in php only to get angry at its limitations) is a waste of time.

Its hack and slash.

Its for 15 year olds.

Its for those who dont want to build web applications, but want to build blogs.

Attempts to do anything of any significant scale will produce unmanagable code, no doubt full of exploits (this can be put back down to the user, but its due to the nature of the language in reality) and uhm, herpies.

Yes, php gives you herpies. I said it, and I wont take it back.

Read full topic

item.title: What is PHP and is it required on websites
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

PHP takes your website, takes all the images, and replaces it with fat gay porn. Seriously.

Naw, PHP, is free, powerful, server-side tool that can do anything on the server. Then the server spits it back out as html. So you can’t steal the source code.
